ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed hearing loss (Left ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of chronic otitis media, eustachian tube dysfunction, and four otosurgeries including ossiculoplasty. Audiogram confirms mixed loss.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss (Right ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Consistent with age (76 years) and lack of conductive component.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds given reported deterioration.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The evaluation revealed asymmetric hearing. The right ear showed slight sensorineural hearing loss sloping to mild. The left ear showed a mixed hearing loss, moderately severe in the lows rising to mild in the mids and sloping to moderate-to-severe in the highs. Speech recognition was excellent bilaterally. Results were stable compared to the previous test 3 years ago, despite the patient's subjective report of deterioration.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Slight SNHL (250-3000 Hz, except normal at 500 Hz) sloping to mild (4000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Mixed hearing loss; moderately severe (250-2000 Hz) rising to mild, then sloping to moderate-to-severe (3000-8000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 20 dB HL, WRS 92% at 65 dB HL. Left SRT 47 dB HL, WRS 92% at 85 dB HL. Excellent recognition bilaterally.

proposed_items: Hearing aid evaluation to discuss options for amplification and Hearing Assistive Technology (HAT)
Use hearing protection in noise as needed
counseling_actions: Reviewed hearing test results with the patient
Explained that thresholds showed minimal changes compared to the previous test despite subjective deterioration

escalation.rationale_short: Patient is to follow up with an otologist as scheduled for chronic ear history.
